Name: LU 61 - Landmarks, EMS Station 17 New Facility, Bronx (210293 PSX)
Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 210293 PSX (L.U. No. 61), for the site selection of property located at 1257 Morris Avenue (Block 2450, Lot 42) for use as an ambulance station EMS facility, Borough of the Bronx, Community District 4.

History.Description: This Resolution was Approved by Committee
A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

Attachments.Name: Calendar of the Landmarks, Public Sitings and Dispositions Subcommittee - June 7, 2022
Calendar of the Subcommittee Meetings and Land Use Meeting - June 14, 2022
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - June 16, 2022

{\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1033{\fonttbl{\f0\froman\fprq2\fcharset0 Times New Roman;}{\f1\fmodern\fprq1\fcharset0 Courier;}}

\viewkind4\uc1
\v0\par
\pard\ltrpar\keepn\nowidctlpar\s1\qj\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928 By Council Members Salamanca and Louis \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\b0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tab WHEREAS, the New York City \cf1\lang4105 Fire Department (NYFD) and the Department of Citywide Administrative Services\cf0\lang1033  (DCAS)\cf1 , \cf0 filed an application pursuant to Section 197-c of the New York City Charter for \cf1 the site selection of property located at 1257 Morris Avenue (Block 2450, Lot 42) for use as an ambulance station EMS facility, which in conjunction with the related action \cf0 would facilitate the relocation of an FDNY ambulance station, known as Emergency Medical Service (EMS) 17, to a new facility that will accommodate ambulances, equipment and personnel and be located at 1257 Morris Avenue Block 2450, Lot 42) in the Concourse neighborhood of Bronx, Community District 4\cf1  \cf0 (ULURP No. C\f1  \f0 210293 PSX) (the \ldblquote Application\rdblquote );\cf1\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\ri144\qj\cf0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\sl240\slmult0\qj\tx0\tx720\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\tx9360\expndtw-3\tab WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission filed with the Council on May 13, 2022 its decision dated April 27, 2022 (the "Decision") on the Application;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\qj\tx0\tx720\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\tx9360\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\expndtw0\tab WHEREAS, the Application is related to application C 210294 ZSX (L.U. No. 62), a special permit pursuant to Zoning Resolution (ZR) Section 74-67 to allow an ambulance station in a residential zoning district;\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi1\qj\tx720\tab WHEREAS, the Decision is subject to review and action by the Council pursuant to Section 197-d of the City Charter;\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj       \tab WHEREAS, upon due notice, the Council held a public hearing on the Decision and Application on June 7, 2022;\par
\par
\tab WHEREAS, the Council has considered the land use implications and other policy issues relating to the Decision and Application; and \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\hyphpar0\sl240\slmult0\qj\tx0\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\tx9360\expndtw-3\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\expndtw0 WHEREAS, the Council has considered the relevant environmental issues, including the Negative Declaration issued March 20\super th\nosupersub , 2021 (CEQR No. 20FDO001X) (the \ldblquote Negative Declaration\rdblquote ).\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928 RESOLVED:  \par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj\tx0\tx720\tx1260\tx1440\tx1620 The Council finds that the action described herein will have no significant impact on the environment as set forth in the Negative Declaration.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj Pursuant to Section 197-d of the City Charter and on the basis of the Decision and Application, and based on the environmental determination and consideration described in the report, C 210293 PSX, incorporated by reference herein, and the record before the Council, the Council approves the Decision of the City Planning Commission, approving the application by the New York City Fire Department and the Department of Citywide Administrative Services for the site selection of property located at 1257 Morris Avenue between East 167\super th\nosupersub  and East 169\super th\nosupersub  Streets (Block 2450, Lot 42), Borough of the Bronx, for use as an EMS facility.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\par
Adopted.\par
\par
      \tab Office of the City Clerk, \}\par

\par
